alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 11:45AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacting Area Tonight into Tuesday Night... .A winter storm is on track to bring impactful and hazardous winter weather to the region. Conditions will worsen late tonight into Tuesday afternoon with hourly snow rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour likely across parts of northeast Iowa and southwest into central Wisconsin. With these higher rates expected early Tuesday, the morning commute will be impacted especially south of Interstate 90. In addition, northwest winds will increase with gusts 30 to 40 mph expected at times Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday night. This will result in blowing and drifting snow, especially across unsheltered areas and along ridgetops. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday morning and evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
